title: North Atlantic Treaty signed (Washington Treaty)
summary: 12 founding members sign the North Atlantic Treaty in Washington, D.C.

title: North Atlantic Treaty enters into force
summary: The treaty becomes legally binding after ratifications are deposited.

title: Military Committee becomes permanent
summary: Permanent military governance structure formalized.

title: Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe (SHAPE) established
summary: SHAPE is created with Gen. Dwight D. Eisenhower as first SACEUR.

title: Greece and Turkey join NATO
summary: Alliance expands to 14 members.

title: NAC Ministerial practice established
summary: Regular foreign and defence minister meetings institutionalized.

title: Federal Republic of Germany accedes
summary: West Germany becomes a NATO member; Warsaw Pact forms soon after.

title: Suez Crisis & Hungarian Uprising
summary: Crises test Alliance cohesion; NATO focuses on consultation and stability.

title: Paris Summit Declaration
summary: Heads of State and Government affirm collective defence and political consultation.

title: NATO Science Programme launched
summary: Begins civil science cooperation across Allies.

title: Civil Emergency Planning enhanced
summary: Allies expand civil preparedness and resilience work.

title: Nuclear Planning Group formed
summary: Forum for nuclear policy consultation.

title: France withdraws from NATO’s integrated military command
summary: France remains an Ally but leaves the integrated command structure.

title: NATO HQ moves to Brussels
summary: Alliance political headquarters relocates from Paris to Brussels.

title: Harmel Report adopted
summary: Sets dual-track approach of deterrence and détente.

title: Warsaw Pact invasion of Czechoslovakia condemned
summary: NATO consults on security implications.

title: Support for CSCE process
summary: Backs negotiations that lead to Helsinki Final Act (1975).

title: Cyprus crisis strains Allies
summary: Alliance navigates intra-Allied tensions; focus on de-escalation.

title: Long-Term Defence Programme
summary: Cooperative efforts to strengthen conventional forces.

title: Dual-Track Decision
summary: Allies decide to deploy INF missiles while pursuing arms control talks.

title: Spain joins NATO
summary: Alliance grows to 16 members.

title: KAL 007 shootdown response
summary: Allies coordinate political response; stress air safety.

title: Support for arms control momentum
summary: Allies back negotiations leading to the INF Treaty.

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
summary: Historic change reshapes NATO’s strategic environment.

title: London Declaration
summary: Allies reach out to former adversaries; NATO transforms.

title: New Strategic Concept (Rome)
summary: First post–Cold War Strategic Concept adopted.

title: Support to UN/EU in Balkans begins
summary: Maritime and air operations in Adriatic; AWACS over Bosnia.

title: Partnership for Peace launched
summary: Framework for cooperation with non‑Allies.

title: Operation Deny Flight
summary: NATO’s first combat operation; enforces no‑fly zone over Bosnia.

title: Operation Deliberate Force
summary: Air strikes against Bosnian Serb targets after Srebrenica.

title: IFOR deployed to Bosnia and Herzegovina
summary: Implements the military aspects of the Dayton Peace Agreement.

title: SFOR replaces IFOR
summary: Stabilization Force continues peace implementation in Bosnia.

title: NATO–Russia Founding Act
summary: Establishes framework for relations and the NATO‑Russia Council.

title: NATO–Ukraine Charter signed
summary: Establishes Distinctive Partnership with Ukraine.

title: Madrid Summit
summary: Invites CZ, HU, PL; launches EAPC.

title: Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland join
summary: First post–Cold War enlargement.

title: Operation Allied Force (Kosovo)
summary: Air campaign to halt humanitarian catastrophe.

title: 1999 Strategic Concept
summary: Updates NATO’s tasks and approach at Washington Summit.

title: Article 5 invoked after 9/11
summary: Collective defence clause invoked for the first time.

title: NATO–Russia Council created
summary: Replaces Permanent Joint Council; meets at 20.

title: Prague Summit
summary: NATO Response Force; Prague Capabilities Commitment.

title: NATO assumes command of ISAF (Afghanistan)
summary: Alliance leads UN‑mandated mission in Kabul, later across Afghanistan.

title: NATO Training Mission–Iraq announced
summary: Supports training Iraqi security forces.

title: Seven countries join NATO
summary: Bulgaria, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia.

title: Pakistan earthquake relief
summary: Strategic airlift and assistance via Euro-Atlantic Disaster Response.

title: Riga Summit
summary: Readiness and transformation; comprehensive approach.

title: Bucharest Summit
summary: Allies agree that Georgia and Ukraine will become members in future; invite Albania and Croatia.

title: Russia–Georgia war response
summary: NATO condemns use of force; supports Georgia’s territorial integrity.

title: Albania and Croatia join
summary: Alliance reaches 28 members.

title: Lisbon Strategic Concept
summary: Defines core tasks: collective defence, crisis management, cooperative security.

title: Smart Defence initiative
summary: Pooling and sharing to address capability gaps.

title: Operation Unified Protector (Libya)
summary: Enforces UN arms embargo and no‑fly zone; protects civilians.

title: Chicago Summit
summary: Focus on Afghanistan transition and Smart Defence.

title: Practical civilian and military cooperation with Russia suspended
summary: Response to Russia’s actions in Ukraine.

title: Wales Summit
summary: Adopts Readiness Action Plan after Russia’s illegal annexation of Crimea.

title: Very High Readiness Joint Task Force (VJTF) operational
summary: Spearhead force for rapid deployment.

title: Warsaw Summit
summary: Enhanced Forward Presence in Baltic States and Poland approved.

title: Montenegro joins NATO
summary: Alliance reaches 29 members.

title: Brussels Summit
summary: Burden-sharing, readiness, and command structure adaptation.

title: Allies conclude Russia in material breach of INF Treaty
summary: Support US finding; urge compliance.

title: London Leaders’ Meeting (70th)
summary: Focus on deterrence, terrorism, resilience, 5G security.

title: North Macedonia joins NATO
summary: Alliance reaches 30 members.

title: Brussels Summit 2021
summary: NATO 2030 agenda endorsed; resilience, technology, and partnerships.

title: Russia’s mission to NATO closed
summary: Relations further downgraded.

title: Support to Ukraine intensified
summary: Allies provide unprecedented military and non‑military assistance following Russia’s full‑scale invasion.

title: Extraordinary Summit on Ukraine
summary: New battle groups in Bulgaria, Hungary, Romania, Slovakia.

title: Madrid Strategic Concept
summary: New Strategic Concept names Russia as the most significant and direct threat; addresses China.

title: NATO Innovation Fund operational
summary: First multi-sovereign VC fund for defence-related dual-use tech.

title: Finland joins NATO
summary: Alliance reaches 31 members.

title: Vilnius Summit
summary: Defence plans approved; strengthened industrial base and support for Ukraine.

title: Defence Production Action Plan advances
summary: Measures to scale defence industrial capacity.

title: Sweden joins NATO
summary: Alliance reaches 32 members.

title: Ukraine Comprehensive Assistance Package expanded
summary: Long-term support commitments enhanced.

title: Washington Summit (75th anniversary)
summary: Allies mark 75 years; further commitments to defence production and Ukraine support.
